edu.cmu.sv.sdsp.api

Class APIIntegrationTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.sv.sdsp.api.BaseTest
      • edu.cmu.sv.sdsp.api.APIIntegrationTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.cmu.sv.sdsp.util.APIConstants

    public class APIIntegrationTest
extends edu.cmu.sv.sdsp.api.BaseTest
    This JUnit test will test all apis provided in CMU-SV SDSP. The baic steps are to create random data and send request to the Einstain server, and check whether the result is right or not.
    Author:
    Gonghan Wang, Surya Kiran

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      This rule is to set the maximum running time for each task.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      APIIntegrationTest()
      Singleton pattern is used here to create two factories and reuse them for all api test requests.

    • Field Detail

      • globalTimeout

        public Timeout globalTimeout
        This rule is to set the maximum running time for each task. When a test runs over the rule time, cause a failure and go next. The Timeout(1000*10) means the time can't exceed 10 seconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • APIIntegrationTest

        public APIIntegrationTest()
        Singleton pattern is used here to create two factories and reuse them for all api test requests.

    • Method Detail

      • testNewDevicesShowupInGet

        public void testNewDevicesShowupInGet()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        The test will check whether the devices show up as expected. First send a get request of device object and then receive feedback from the server machine. If result is 'device saved', success. Otherwise, failure.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testSensorOperations

        public void testSensorOperations()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This test is to check whether the sensor operations work as expected. First, add a sensor type and invoke the API to add a new device type. Next make sure the temperature sensor will return a valid response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testDeviceOperations

        public void testDeviceOperations()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This test is to check whether the device operations work well. First, process a test of the sensor type and return in json objects. Next, invoke the API to add a new device type. Check the response and if it is not null, success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testPostGetSensors

        public void testPostGetSensors()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This test is to check when get and post requests work well on the sensors. First, generate a sensor readings and publish it to the server. Next, query that readings and check whether it's there in the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testGetReadingsByTimeFrame

        public void testGetReadingsByTimeFrame()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        To test whether the readings by the time frame is as expected. First test Query sensor readings for a specific type of sensor, in a particular device, for a specific time range. After getting this result, check the sensor readings of all devices. If both responses are right, success.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testGetAll

        public void testGetAll()
                throws java.io.IOException
        To get all devices and all sensors are alive, not dead. First, send a request to all devices and get basic types and formats of them. Second, send a request to all sensors and get sensor readings of all devices.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testLastestReadings

        public void testLastestReadings()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This test is to check all lastest readings. Send a request to get latest reading for a sensor type in all registered devices.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testSpecificSensor

        public void testSpecificSensor()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This test is to test a specific sensor. First get readings of a specific sensor. Make sure the response is not null. Second, check the time range of the sensor readings.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
